subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|i}} – a man with a mask ({{zh-l|*田}}) over his face. Possible interpretations:

* Strange, bizarre — "uncommon".
* Different face — "different".

Compare {{zh-l|*鬼|demon}}, where the {{lang|zh|田}} also derives from a face.

Modern form is graphically {{Han compound|田|共}}, though this is not the etymology.
